page.title: 09HOMELIFE SCRAPTOFT THURNBY
page.content: Homelife in 1985 is quite comfortable. The homes in general are quite modern and many tenants are making improvements to their property.Lots of people have central heating and many are putting in double glazing to keep themselves warmer in winter.Most houses have radio,TV,and a record or cassette player,and more people are buying video players as well.In the kitchen there is likely to be a washing machine and a spin drier.Some families have dish washers. Most homes have a garden back and front where the grow vegetables and flowers. Private houses usually have a garage, but those people living on council estates usually have to park on the road.More garages are being built where there is space next to the house.
